body:
Facebook, Inc. (FB) is an interesting player in the Technology space, with a focus on Internet Information Providers. The stock has been active on the tape, currently trading at $129.37, up from yesterday’s close by 0.34%. Given the stock’s recent action, it seemed like a good time to take a closer look at the company’s recent data.

Money managers are always interested in a company that can find the right recipe of fundamental data because it reflects something important going on underneath the surface. Facebook, Inc. (FB) currently trades with a market capitalization of $374.36 Billion. That value represents a market adjusting for revenues that have been growing by 55.77 % on a quarterly year/year basis as of the company’s last quarterly report.

The balance sheet health of any company plays a key role in its ability to meet its obligations and maintain the faith of its investment base. For FB, the company currently has $6.04 Billion of cash on the books, which is offset by $- current liabilities. You can get a sense of how sustainable that is by a levered free cash flow of $8.67 Billion over the past twelve months. Generally speaking, earnings are expected to fall in coming quarters. Analysts are forecasting earnings of $1.12 on a per share basis this quarter. Perhaps, that suggests something about why 0.30% of the outstanding share supply is held by institutional investors.

As most professionals know, technical analysis can offer critical insights into what smart money and insiders think about a stock’s prospects going forward. Looking at the stock’s movement on the chart, Facebook, Inc. recorded a 52-week high of $133.50. It is now trading 4.13% off that level. The stock is trading $120.50 its 50-day moving average by -8.87%. The stock carved out a 52-week low down at $94.23.

In recent action, Facebook, Inc. (FB) has made a move of +10.20% over the past month, which has come on weak relative transaction volume. Over the trailing year, the stock is underperforming the S&P 500 by 13.1, and it’s gotten there by action that has been less volatile on a day-to-day basis than most other stocks on the exchange. In terms of the mechanics underlying that movement, traders will want to note that the stock is trading on a float of 0.83% with $2.26 Billion sitting short, betting on future declines. That suggests something of the likelihood of a short squeeze in shares of FB.
title: Just the Facts on Facebook, Inc. (FB) | StockNewsJournal
